text: this place is great enough just on pricing .but its so great to go to a place and they show there belief in the lord by there actions and the way they treat others. my metal for my house was so unreliable cheap but they treated me like I was a very important customer .I was amazed. and will never shop anywhere else or recommend

text: Undecided on what color metal I wanted for my new roof, Zack offered to mail me a samples to help me decide. Fast shipping and great customer service helping me decide and pay over the phone. I appreciate the kindness and respectful tone he presented to a undecided first time homeowner. Thank you Zack!

name: Debora McCutcheon
text: Do not do business with the guys!!! They take your money and don’t finish the job!!! We’ve been waiting over a year now. And they will not respond to phone calls.  Terrible customer service!!

resp.text: Deborah, My name is Zac Smith and I am the owner of Agcor. Please call me at the office on Monday. I have never heard of you before but I will be glad to see what the issue is. My personal email address is zsmith@agcorsteel.com. I am sure I can get to the bottom of it in a few minutes.

name: Bob Sancken
text:
Testimonial for K & G Metals

This Spring I had the pleasure of getting a carport put up by K+G Metals. What I ended up with was a structure considerably nicer than the standard”rounded eaves”carports that you see all over. Glynn(who’s family owns the business) was my”Low Pressure”sales person,who remained completely calm as I changed my mind 3-4 times.LOL I ended up with building with regular looking eves with overhang. I ended up having 3 sides closed in. I had contacted 3-4 other places and was left with little reassurance that they would even show up,and they all wanted the spot to be level within 3-4 inches,my spot was sloping at least 12 inches,I explained this to Glynn and he compensated for it”no problem”. So far a”smooth talker”could have led me along,now it’s time to actually build something. The crew,Alben and Richard showed up early with a nice”business looking”rig:a nice heavy duty pickup with a nice trailer,not a”Rag-Tag”looking outfit. All of their cordless tools were Milwaukee brand and neatly stowed. They snapped a chalk line for the screws and did a great job”boxing in”the corners and enclosing the the far end. Yes, I spent a little more than I had planned but not much. What I ended up with looks pretty much like a garage,not something you bought at a farm store to put hay in. Bob,very happy customer in New Market.

resp.text: Bob, you are so kind! Thank you for your awesome review. It was a pleasure doing business with you!!

text: It was good the young man was very helpful  will go back

resp.text: Thank you Rhonda!!

name: Deann Roten
text: We needed some metal roofing for a chicken pen was able to get some damage 3ft by10ft for $18 a sheet. Was able to use them .

name: SV Jones
text:
I called them today and asked about the availability of a product. I was transferred to a salesman. After I explained what I needed, he repeated three times: we have (name of product). No more, no less. I was not encouraged to ask any more questions about the product he named. He then advised me to check Google, and after I did that, to call back and tell them whether what they had was what I needed.
I was driving, so I pulled over and Googled the product he mentioned. It looked good, so I called back. He was on the phone so I drove over to the business.
A gentleman with a radio met me outside and was very cordial. He called the same salesman on the radio and, per my request, asked what the price was. I could clearly overhear the salesman on the other end.
He said "we have to get these customers to start calling in." He stated the price, then asked for my name and I gave it. He asked if it would be cash and I relayed that it would be my debit card. He could not find my name in the system (I have done light business there in the past and last time my name was in the system.) He then told the gentleman on the radio that I was not in the system and would have to call in my order and credit card information, then I could come back and buy the single item that I needed.
I left and found the product I needed at a steel supply in Montgomery.
I'm not a huge commercial contractor, and I don't represent much money to these businesses. But I'm still a prospective customer. I have always had a great and pleasant experience at Alabama Steel, pre-Covid and during Covid. Today was .not typical but it sure made me feel that it didn't matter if I took my money elsewhere. Kudos to the outside sales guy, though.
But there is a silver lining: because of this negative experience,  I found an alternate steel business which displays professionalism, great customer skills and makes me feel valued, no matter how small my purchase may be. I spent my career in customer-oriented businesses, and if I have to drive a few more miles to receive good customer service, then that is where my money will go.
